heading: is palm losing its grip?
subheading: handspring licenses the palm os for its handheld, then releases a more flexible organizer. is the palm dynasty on shaky ground? by leander kahney.
author: leander kahney
text: handspring might be biting the palm that feeds it by stealing away part of the handheld market. handspring, which has strong ties to palm computing, unveiled a handheld on tuesday that can be turned into a mp3 player, mobile phone, pager, or even a heart monitor.see also: 3com spinning off palm
